column10: I jab my fingers against the screen of my phone the little avatar hops up and down in an effort to dodge the man-eating kale.
Dmi!
I yelp and nearly drop my phone. I catch it just before it slips out of my fingers and glare at the slime man in front of me.
You’ve seriously got to stop doing that!
Rob bursts into laughter.
It’s just too funny. Look, you got goosebumps on your goosebumps!
whatever, how’s packing?
We’ll be done by tonight. Then we leave tomorrow morning in time for our space jump outta here.
Ah, a space jump. That's everyone’s ticket outta the solar system to go wherever they’re going next.
They are ways outta here without one, but the trip is pretty grueling.
Not to mention the luncos to afford a space jump is insane.
I’ll come pick up Flubber at the end of the day.
Also, smile a little today! Use that slogan of ours to brighten their days.
Ugh.
I’ll try.
Great! I’ll see you later. Be nice to Flubber!
Mreoww…
We’re pals, aren’t we Flubber?
-door chimes and closes-
Flubber gives me a slow blink.
-door chimes and opens-
A two-headed beastman enters. They don’t say a word. I yawn and start spouting the “Cosmic Fuel welcome”.
Welcome to Cosmic Fuel. Fill to your heart’s content, that’s the Cosmic Fuel way.
The beastmen frantically grab items and stuff them into a bag.
Well, that’s not at all what I meant.
You guys using cash or credit?
The more dimwitted looking one whispers to the sharper one and they stalk forward.
This is a stick up! Open the register!
The dimwitted-looking beast-man pulls out a stick from his pocket and points at me.
and give us those Saturn dogs behind you!
Yeah! And--
The sharp-eyed beastman glares at his brother.
Sorry Romulus, stickups make me hungry.
You’re worse than a chihuahua. When I said we’re doing a stickup, I didn’t mean to put a literal stickup!
Oh, did I mess up again? Are we not getting Saturn dogs?
No you didn’t mess up, Remus. Let’s get you that hot dog. No no, let’s get you two of them. How about that?
Remus howls with excitement.
Please pick an item from the shop
Romulus grits his teeth.
Is this some kind of joke? We asked for Saturn dogs!
I know.
Why give us this?
You’re already helping yourself to the shelves. Why don’t you get them yourself?
Aww…I think they’re mad at us, Rom.
I told you we shouldn’t steal.
STOP TAKING ME AS A FOOL REM!
Hey! He’s not taking you as a fool.
Romulus’ eyes shine with a hopeful look.
I’m taking you as a fool too.
Romulus drops the bag on the ground. He looks close to tears.
Remus…lets just go.
I slide two Saturn dogs to the pair. Remus helps himself and scarfs it down.
and now the register--
Rom… they were so nice and gave us a Saturn dog. Do we have to?
Of course! We came all this way just to--
To steal?
Romulus stutters in shock.
Remus doesn’t look too different from a kicked puppy.
Mom always told us stealing was bad. We should pay!
I don’t really care either way, to be honest…
The two ignore me. I can practically hear the galaxy’s smallest violin play for the two.
You’re right Rem… I can’t do it. I wanted to be the tough guy so bad… everything is going to get blown to smithereens!
I just wanted to do something cool!
Will you ever forgive me?
You’re the best big brother ever! Of course, I will!
The two beastmen burst into tears.
I just stand there watching the two go through a whole movie scene together.
Romulus sets a pile of luncos on the counter.
Keep the change. We’re sorry for bothering you.
-door chimes and closes-
I reach for my phone. Cassiopeia’s not going to believe this.
